alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Norfolk, east central Suffolk and north central Plymouth Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hull, or near Quincy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches and small trees. Brief heavy downpours could lead to localized minor street flooding. Locations impacted include... Boston, Quincy, Weymouth, Braintree, Marshfield, Hingham, Scituate, Winthrop, Rockland, Hanover, Norwell, Hull and Cohasset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk; Western Plymouth
